DataElement.preferredName: Newly Diagnosed Or Recurrent Refractory Disease Receive Prior Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol that address a new diagnosed or relapsed/refractory disease who have received prior therapeutic treatments.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Newly Diagnosed Disease or Disorder Or Recurrent Disease Refractory Disease Receive Prior Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Very recently determined._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The return of a disease after a period of remission._A disease that resists treatment._To take, accept, or get something offered._Earlier in time or order._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have or suspecte
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have or suspected to have one of the following: Newly diagnosed Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) associated with antecedent myeloproliferative disorder (Polycythermia Vera, Essential Thrombocythemia, Myelofibrosis, atypical Chronic Myeloid Leukemia, Chronic Myelomonocytic Leukemia and related undifferentiated myeloproliferative/myelodysplastic disorders);  OR Relapsed/refractory AML associated with antecedent myeloproliferative disorder (Polycythermia Vera, Essential Thrombocythemia, Myelofibrosis, atypical Chronic Myeloid Leukemia, Chronic Myelomonocytic Leukemia and related undifferentiated myeloproliferative/myelodysplastic disorders) who have received two or fewer prior induction chemotherapy courses; OR Accelerated phase myeloproliferative disorders per Zeider et al with two or fewer prior therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed AML (non- acute promyelocytic leukemia [APL] that is relapsed or refractory to at least one prior line of therapy or MDS, that meets all of the following at the time of enrollment: Higher risk MDS (intermediate-2 or high risk by the original IPSS) (Greenberg et al., 1997), and Relapsed, refractory, or intolerant to at least one prior line of therapy containing a hypomethylating agent (DNA methyltransferase inhibitor)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a second or greater relapse after chemotherapy or hematopoietic stem cell transplant (HSCT)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has AML or MDS, has disease relapsed after or is refractory to, first line therapy, with or without subsequent additional therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have pathologically confirmed biliary tract cancer, having received at least 1 prior line of systemic therapy, and received no more than 2 prior lines of therapy in the metastatic setting (disease recurrence less than 6 months from the last dose of perioperative therapy or day of surgery [whichever is more recent] in resected patients will be considered the first line of therapy)?
